intro: Weihea mossambicensis, commonly known as the Mozambique hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, tropical environments. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. The species plays a role in local ecosystems and may have traditional uses in some cultures.
